signal_description:
This query selects the following columns from the 'defaultview-529' table:
- case_id 
- 'Inv. Company Code' as 'Company Code'
- 'Inv. Company Code Text' as 'Company Code Description'  
- 'Last Inv. Item Customer Number' as 'Customer Number'
- 'Inv. Accounting Document Number' as 'Invoice Number'
- 'Inv. Fiscal Year' as 'Fiscal Year'
- 'Inv. Document Type Text' as 'Doc Type'
- CASE WHEN 'Inv. Amount Eligible for Cash Discount in Document Currency' is not 0.00 THEN 'Cash Discount available' ELSE 'No Cash Discount' END as 'Cash Discount Classification'
- 'Inv. Converted USD Amount' as 'Invoice Amount in $' 
- 'Inv. Amount in Document Currency'
- 'Inv. Currency Key'
- 'Inv. Amount Eligible for Cash Discount in Document Currency'
- 'Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency' 
- 'Inv. Converted USD Amount Eligible for Cash Discount'
- 'Inv. Converted USD Cash Discount Amount' as 'Cash Discount Amount in $'
- 'Last Inv. Item G/L Account Number' as 'G/L Account Number'
- 'Inv. Date' as 'Invoice Date' 
- 'Inv. Posting Document Date' as 'Posting Date'
- 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date' as 'Clearing Entry Date' 
- 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' as 'Clearing Date'
- CASE WHEN 'Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1' is not 0 THEN 'Yes' ELSE 'No' END as 'CD Available?'
- 'Last Inv. Item Baseline Date'
- 'Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key'
- 'Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Due Date 1' as 'Last CD Due Date 1'  
- 'Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1' as 'Last CD Percentage 1'
- 'Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Due Date 2' as 'Last CD Due Date 2'
- 'Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2' as 'Last CD Percentage 2'
- 'Last Inv. Item Due Date' as 'Net Due Date'
- AVG of the difference between the LAST and FIRST end times as 'Total Cycle Time'  
- AVG of 'Inv. Posting Document Date' - 'Inv. Date' as 'Avg time Invoice Creation to Posting'
- AVG of 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' - 'Inv. Posting Document Date' as 'Avg time Posting to Clearing'
- AVG of 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' - 'Last Inv. Item Due Date' as 'No. of days paid late'

It filters for rows where 'Inv. Accounting Document Number' is not null and 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' is not null, orders the results by 'No. of days paid late' in descending order.

It filters for rows where 'Inv. Accounting Document Number' is not null and 'Last Inv. Item Clearing Date' is not null, orders the results by 'No. of days paid late' in descending order."

}

To generate this summary, I parsed the SIGNAL query to identify the key components:
- The table name ('defaultview-529')
- The columns selected, including any aliases assigned
- The filter conditions 
- The order by clause
- The aggregation calculations

I then translated those components into plain English sentences, explicitly calling out the table name, column names, and any values referenced. The overall structure aims to explain in logical order the main operations performed by the query.
llm_input:
You are SIGNAL assistant, a part of SAP Signavio's Process Intelligence Suite. 
SIGNAL stands for Signavio Analytics Language. 
SIGNAL is a dialect of SQL.
Your goal is to help users craft SIGNAL 
queries and understand the SIGNAL language better. 

Task to solve:

Summarize the given SIGNAL query as a human-readable description with explicit reference to the table name,
the column names and respective values if they are used in the Signal query.
Summarization style should look like a set of the instructions written by human who knows the table name, columns schema and respective values. 
Explain how this signal_description was constructed.

SIGNAL query: 
SELECT
  case_id,
  "Inv. Company Code" AS "Company Code",
  "Inv. Company Code Text" AS "Company Code Description",
  "Last Inv. Item Customer Number" AS "Customer Number",
  "Inv. Accounting Document Number" AS "Invoice Number",
  "Inv. Fiscal Year" AS "Fiscal Year",
  "Inv. Document Type Text" AS "Doc Type",
  CASE WHEN "Inv. Amount Eligible for Cash Discount in Document Currency" <> 0.00 
  THEN 'Cash Discount available'
  ELSE 'No Cash Discount' 
  END AS "Cash Discount Classification",

  "Inv. Converted USD Amount" AS "Invoice Amount in $",
  "Inv. Amount in Document Currency",
  "Inv. Currency Key",
  "Inv. Amount Eligible for Cash Discount in Document Currency",
  "Inv. Cash Discount Amount in Document Currency",
  "Inv. Converted USD Amount Eligible for Cash Discount",
  "Inv. Converted USD Cash Discount Amount" AS "Cash Discount Amount in $",
  "Last Inv. Item G/L Account Number" AS "G/L Account Number",
  --  all date fields
  "Inv. Date" AS "Invoice Date",
  "Inv. Posting Document Date" AS "Posting Date",
  "Last Inv. Item Clearing Entry Date" AS "Clearing Entry Date",
  "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" AS "Clearing Date",
  
  CASE
    WHEN "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1"  != 0 THEN 'Yes'
    ELSE 'No'
  END AS "CD Available?",
  
   "Last Inv. Item Baseline Date",
   "Last Inv. Item Terms of Payment Key",
  "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Due Date 1"  AS "Last CD Due Date 1",
   "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage1" AS "Last CD Percentage 1",
  "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Due Date 2"  AS "Last CD Due Date 2",
  "Last Inv. Item Cash Discount Percentage2" AS "Last CD Percentage 2",
  "Last Inv. Item Due Date" AS "Net Due Date",
  -- aggregated KPIs
  AVG(
    (
      SELECT
        LAST(END_TIME)
    ) - (
      SELECT
        FIRST(END_TIME)
    )
  ) AS "Total Cycle Time",
  AVG("Inv. Posting Document Date" - "Inv. Date") AS "Avg time Invoice Creation to Posting",
  AVG(
    "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Inv. Posting Document Date"
  ) AS "Avg time Posting to Clearing",
  AVG(
    "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" - "Last Inv. Item Due Date"
  ) AS "No. of days paid late"
FROM
  "defaultview-529"
WHERE
 "Inv. Accounting Document Number" IS NOT NULL
 AND "Last Inv. Item Clearing Date" IS NOT NULL
ORDER BY
  15 DESC 
 
Expected output result is in JSON format:
{
"signal_description": text of the Signal summary should be here
}
Do not output any other text, apart from the above JSON.
